lines.text: Enter two Citizens meeting

lines.speaker: first citizen
lines.text: Neighbour, well met: whither away so fast

lines.speaker: second citizen
lines.text: I promise you, I scarcely know myself: Hear you the news abroad

lines.speaker: first citizen
lines.text: Ay, that the king is dead.

lines.speaker: second citizen
lines.text: Bad news, byr lady seldom comes the better: I fear, I fear twill prove a troublous world.
Enter another Citizen

lines.speaker: third citizen
lines.text: Neighbours, God speed!

lines.speaker: first citizen
lines.text: Give you good morrow, sir.

lines.speaker: third citizen
lines.text: Doth this news hold of good King Edwards death

lines.speaker: second citizen
lines.text: Ay, sir, it is too true God help the while!

lines.speaker: third citizen
lines.text: Then, masters, look to see a troublous world.

lines.speaker: first citizen
lines.text: No, no by Gods good grace his son shall reign.

lines.speaker: third citizen
lines.text: Woe to the land thats governd by a child!

lines.speaker: second citizen
lines.text: In him there is a hope of government, That in his nonage council under him, And in his full and ripend years himself, No doubt, shall then and till then govern well.

lines.speaker: first citizen
lines.text: So stood the state when Henry the Sixth Was crownd in Paris but at nine months old.

lines.speaker: third citizen
lines.text: Stood the state so No, no, good friends, God wot For then this land was famously enrichd With politic grave counsel then the king Had virtuous uncles to protect his grace.

lines.speaker: first citizen
lines.text: Why, so hath this, both by the father and mother.

lines.speaker: third citizen
lines.text: Better it were they all came by the father, Or by the father there were none at all For emulation now, who shall be nearest, Will touch us all too near, if God prevent not. O, full of danger is the Duke of Gloucester! And the queens sons and brothers haught and proud: And were they to be ruled, and not to rule, This sickly land might solace as before.

lines.speaker: first citizen
lines.text: Come, come, we fear the worst all shall be well.

lines.speaker: third citizen
lines.text: When clouds appear, wise men put on their cloaks When great leaves fall, the winter is at hand When the sun sets, who doth not look for night Untimely storms make men expect a dearth. All may be well but, if God sort it so, Tis more than we deserve, or I expect.

lines.speaker: second citizen
lines.text: Truly, the souls of men are full of dread: Ye cannot reason almost with a man That looks not heavily and full of fear.

lines.speaker: third citizen
lines.text: Before the times of change, still is it so: By a divine instinct mens minds mistrust Ensuing dangers as by proof, we see The waters swell before a boisterous storm. But leave it all to God. whither away

lines.speaker: second citizen
lines.text: Marry, we were sent for to the justices.

lines.speaker: third citizen
lines.text: And so was I: Ill bear you company.
Exeunt
